articles.summary: The use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to drive business innovation is one of the key topics under discussion at the ANACOM Conference titled "Artificial Intelligence - The Challenges of Innovation and Regulation" taking place on the 19th of this year.

articles.title: How engineering colleges are bridging the compute divide
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: India produces over one million engineering graduates annually. India's engineering education landscape is witnessing a fundamental transformation as Artificial Intelligence (AI) continues to reshape industries worldwide. The question is whether Indian engineering institutions are equipped with the computational skills required for AI-related tasks.

articles.title: AI has enabled Salesforce to slash 4K support roles: CEO
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) has enabled Salesforce to cut 4,000 customer support roles this year. Salesforce's support headcount has been reduced from 9,000 to 6,000 thanks to AI agents taking on more tasks, says CEO Marc Benioff.

articles.title: AI voice cloning is 'cruel': Shaan decodes the unseen problem with this new-age tech
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: Bollywood singer Shaan has criticized the use of AI to clone the voices of legendary singers like Kishore Kumar and Mohammed Rafi. He described the technology as 'unfair' and 'inappropriate'    in his statement.

articles.author: The Verge
articles.summary: LG's FURON AI Agent powers the company's smart home AI ambitions. The holy grail of the smart home is ambient computing - technology that disappears into the background, anticipating your needs without a word or a tap. Lights turn on as you walk in.

articles.title: Chefs are taking food waste off the menu with a little help from AI
articles.author: system
articles.summary: The food-service industry is turning to trash-monitoring AI tools like Winnow to slash food waste. The tech is helping chefs make menu items out of kitchen trimmings and optimize production. This article is part of "How AI Is Changing Everything" series on AI.

AI-powered tools help staff focus on patients in addiction recovery, giving more support behind the scenes. Patients should be allowed to opt out of the use of AI in addiction treatment.

articles.title: Google Is Bringing Gemini AI to Its Smart Home Lineup, Starting Oct. 1
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: Goodbye, Google Assistant. Hello, Gemini. Google Assistant is no longer available on Google's Assistant app. Google has replaced it with Gemini's voice assistant. Google is not available on Gemini's app any more. Google will no longer use it on other apps.

articles.title: OpenAI, Meta adjusting chatbot responses to teens' questions on sensitive topics
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: OpenAI and Meta will adjust chatbot features to better respond to teens in crisis. There have been reports of the bots directing young users to harm themselves or others. They recently introduced a real-time router that can choose between efficient chat models and reasoning models based on the conversation context.

articles.title: CU Boulder to offer free, online course on AI open to the general public
articles.author: Daily Camera
articles.summary: The University of Colorado Boulder will offer a free online course on generative AI from Monday to Friday. The course is for anyone who wants to learn more about AI tools such as ChatGPT but doesn't have a background in computer science. It will include five lectures.

articles.title: With bad AI in courtrooms increasing, SC chief justice joins states like Michigan giving guidance
articles.author: Jessica Holdman
articles.summary: South Carolina's chief justice has issued an interim policy on the use of artificial intelligence in state court proceedings. The policy was recommended by the National Center of State Courts and National Conference of Chief Justices. The interim policy will stay in place until the Supreme Court issues a new order.
